alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:18AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern York, north central Sussex, northeastern Dinwiddie, James City, southeastern Chesterfield, Charles City, Prince George, New Kent, southeastern Henrico, and northwestern Surry Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell, the City of Petersburg and the City of Williamsburg through 900 AM EDT... At 818 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from New Kent to Ettrick. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Hopewell, New Kent, Colonial Heights, Williamsburg, Charles City, Claremont, Disputanta, Talleysville, Norge, Toano, College Of William And Mary, Fort Lee, Roxbury, Virginia State University, Chester, Prince George, Rustic, Burrowsville and Garysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York
